result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Arthur Fiebiger

records.addlTxt: PSC set for this date reset due to Intake running long. RJG
Pre-trial conference on January 17, 2023 at 04:15 pm.

11:47 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: C. Dillon, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Joseph Arthur Fiebiger in court without an attorney.  Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CM337 & 22CT220.  Court reviews file and bond modification request. Court does not modify bond at this time.  Court reviews the no contact on bond.  Victim Witness to contact Atty Wertheimer to alert him that bond won't be changed at this time. ADA Smestad makes statements regarding reports filed by JSC. Court questions DE as to the status of attorney.  DE states Atty Bjork represents him on this matter. Cout will appoint Atty to both these files.  DE to go to JSC to discuss the situation regarding connection.  Adjourned at 11:56 AM. bph
Pretrial Bond Report. Filed by JSC Kayla S. arc   to rg

Includes 22CT220 & 22CM337

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, P. Larson and R.A. Larson and shall at all times remain at least 500 feet from the Larsons' residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.

Modifying Bond signed by SRN on 10/18/22. Def to have no contact with P.L. or R.L. Def to sign bond by 10/26/22. Failure to report to the Clerk of court to sign modified bond may result in the issuance of a warrant.
Bail/bond hearing on October 31, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Wertheimer to have him prepare an order. bph

to Judge Needham requesting additional no contact and restitution on behalf of victim. Filed by Atty. Wertheimer. ec: DA, JA. kma   to kp

Includes 22CT220 & 22CM337

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, P. Larson.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping. 

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.

2:01 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Joseph Arthur Fiebiger in court.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Joseph Arthur Fiebiger.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CM337 & 22CT220.  DE does not qualify for PD, has an attorney retained. As to 22CM337- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  As  to 22CT220- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  DE states  Atty John Bjork has been retained for a different matter.
